    \includegraphics{dilating.pdf}
    \caption{Dilating and contracting functions}\label{fig:dilating-run}
  \end{figure}
‚Ä∫
(*<*)
‚Äï ‚ÄπConstants and notation to be able to write what we want as Isabelle terms, not as LaTeX maths‚Ä∫
consts dummyf    :: ‚Äπnat ‚áí nat‚Ä∫
consts dummyg    :: ‚Äπnat ‚áí nat‚Ä∫
consts dummytwo  :: ‚Äπnat‚Ä∫
notation dummyf    (‚Äπf‚Ä∫) 
notation dummyg    (‚Äπg‚Ä∫)
notation dummytwo  (‚Äπ2‚Ä∫)
(*>*)
text ‚Äπ
  A function @{term ‚Äπg‚Ä∫} is contracting with respect to the dilation of run
  @{term ‚Äπsub‚Ä∫} into run @{term ‚Äπr‚Ä∫} by the dilating function @{term ‚Äπf‚Ä∫} if:
  ‚ñ™ it is a contracting function ;
  ‚ñ™ @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) n‚Ä∫} is the index of the last original instant before instant 
    @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} in run @{term ‚Äπr‚Ä∫}, therefore:
    ‚ñ™ @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) n ‚â§ n ‚Ä∫}
    ‚ñ™ the time does not change on any clock between instants @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) n‚Ä∫}
      and @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} of run @{term ‚Äπr‚Ä∫};
    ‚ñ™ no clock ticks before @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} strictly after @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) n‚Ä∫} 
      in run @{term ‚Äπr‚Ä∫}.
  See \autoref{fig:dilating-run} for a better understanding. Notice that in this 
  example, @{term ‚Äπ2‚Ä∫} is equal to @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) 2‚Ä∫}, @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) 3‚Ä∫}, 
  and @{term ‚Äπ(f ‚àò g) 4‚Ä∫}. 
‚Ä∫
(*<*)
no_notation dummyf      (‚Äπf‚Ä∫) 
no_notation dummyg      (‚Äπg‚Ä∫) 
no_notation dummytwo    (‚Äπ2‚Ä∫)
(*>*)

definition contracting
where 
  ‚Äπcontracting g r sub f ‚â°  contracting_fun g
                          ‚àß (‚àÄn. f (g n) ‚â§ n)
                          ‚àß (‚àÄn c k. f (g n) ‚â§ k ‚àß k ‚â§ n
                              ‚ü∂ time ((Rep_run r) k c) = time ((Rep_run sub) (g n) c))
                          ‚àß (‚àÄn c k. f (g n) < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n
                              ‚ü∂ ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c))‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  For any dilating function, we can build its ‚àó‚Äπinverse‚Ä∫, as illustrated on
  \autoref{fig:dilating-run}, which is a contracting function:
‚Ä∫
definition ‚Äπdil_inverse f::(nat ‚áí nat) ‚â° (Œªn. Max {i. f i ‚â§ n})‚Ä∫

subsection ‚Äπ
  Alternate definitions for counting ticks.
‚Ä∫
text ‚Äπ
  For proving the stuttering invariance of TESL specifications, we will need
  these alternate definitions for counting ticks, which are based on sets.
‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  @{term ‚Äπtick_count r c n‚Ä∫} is the number of ticks of clock @{term c} in 
  run @{term r} upto instant @{term n}.
‚Ä∫
definition tick_count :: ‚Äπ'a::linordered_field run ‚áí clock ‚áí nat ‚áí nat‚Ä∫
where
  ‚Äπtick_count r c n = card {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  @{term ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c n‚Ä∫} is the number of ticks of clock @{term c} 
  in run @{term r} upto but excluding instant @{term n}.
‚Ä∫ 
definition tick_count_strict :: ‚Äπ'a::linordered_field run ‚áí clock ‚áí nat ‚áí nat‚Ä∫
where
  ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c n = card {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫


end

Theory StutteringLemmas

subsection‚ÄπStuttering Lemmas‚Ä∫

theory StutteringLemmas

imports StutteringDefs

begin

text ‚Äπ
  In this section, we prove several lemmas that will be used to show that TESL 
  specifications are invariant by stuttering.

  The following one will be useful in proving properties over a sequence of 
  stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma bounded_suc_ind:
  assumes ‚Äπ‚ãÄk. k < m ‚üπ P (Suc (z + k)) = P (z + k)‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπk < m ‚üπ P (Suc (z + k)) = P z‚Ä∫
proof (induction k)
  case 0
    with assms(1)[of 0] show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc k')
    with assms[of ‚ÄπSuc k'‚Ä∫] show ?case by force
qed

subsection ‚ÄπLemmas used to prove the invariance by stuttering‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπSince a dilating function is strictly monotonous, it is injective.‚Ä∫

lemma dilating_fun_injects:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπinj_on f A‚Ä∫
using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_imp_inj_on by blast

lemma dilating_injects:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπinj_on f A‚Ä∫
using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_injects by blast

text ‚Äπ
  If a clock ticks at an instant in a dilated run, that instant is the image
  by the dilating function of an instant of the original run.
‚Ä∫
lemma ticks_image:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) n c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫
using dilating_fun_def assms by blast

lemma ticks_image_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) n c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫
using assms dilating_def ticks_image by blast

lemma ticks_image_sub':
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπ‚àÉc. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫
using ticks_image_sub[OF assms(1)] assms(2) by blast


text ‚Äπ 
  The image of the ticks in an interval by a dilating function is the interval 
  bounded by the image of the bounds of the original interval.
  This is proven for all 4 kinds of intervals:  ‚ñ©‚Äπ]m, n[‚Ä∫, ‚ñ©‚Äπ[m, n[‚Ä∫, ‚ñ©‚Äπ]m, n]‚Ä∫
  and ‚ñ©‚Äπ[m, n]‚Ä∫.
‚Ä∫

lemma dilating_fun_image_strict:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{k. f m < k ‚àß k < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
            = image f {k. m < k ‚àß k < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)}‚Ä∫
  (is ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k‚á©0) c)‚Ä∫
      using ticks_image[OF assms] by blast
    with h have ‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?IMG ‚äÜ image f ?SET‚Ä∫ ..
next
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπk = f k‚á©0 ‚àß k‚á©0 ‚àà ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫ using assms by (simp add: dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less)
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SET ‚äÜ ?IMG‚Ä∫ ..
qed

lemma dilating_fun_image_left:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{k. f m ‚â§ k ‚àß k < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
          = image f {k. m ‚â§ k ‚àß k < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)}‚Ä∫
  (is ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k‚á©0) c)‚Ä∫
      using ticks_image[OF assms] by blast
    with h have ‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
  } thus ‚Äπ?IMG ‚äÜ image f ?SET‚Ä∫ ..
next
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπk = f k‚á©0 ‚àß k‚á©0 ‚àà ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SET ‚äÜ ?IMG‚Ä∫ ..
qed

lemma dilating_fun_image_right:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{k. f m < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
          = image f {k. m < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)}‚Ä∫
  (is ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k‚á©0) c)‚Ä∫
      using ticks_image[OF assms] by blast
    with h have ‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
  } thus ‚Äπ?IMG ‚äÜ image f ?SET‚Ä∫ ..
next
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπk = f k‚á©0 ‚àß k‚á©0 ‚àà ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SET ‚äÜ ?IMG‚Ä∫ ..
qed

lemma dilating_fun_image:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{k. f m ‚â§ k ‚àß k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
          = image f {k. m ‚â§ k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)}‚Ä∫
  (is ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k‚á©0) c)‚Ä∫
      using ticks_image[OF assms] by blast
    with h have ‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
      using assms dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less_eq by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?IMG ‚äÜ image f ?SET‚Ä∫ ..
next
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?SET‚Ä∫
    from h obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπk = f k‚á©0 ‚àß k‚á©0 ‚àà ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπk ‚àà ?IMG‚Ä∫ using assms by (simp add: dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less_eq)
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SET ‚äÜ ?IMG‚Ä∫ ..
qed

text ‚Äπ
  On any clock, the number of ticks in an interval is preserved
  by a dilating function.
‚Ä∫
lemma ticks_as_often_strict:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπcard {p. n < p ‚àß p < m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f p) c)}
          = card {p. f n < p ‚àß p < f m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) p c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπcard ?SET = card ?IMG‚Ä∫)
proof -
  from dilating_fun_injects[OF assms] have ‚Äπinj_on f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite ?SET‚Ä∫ by simp
  from inj_on_iff_eq_card[OF this] calculation
    have ‚Äπcard (image f ?SET) = card ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from dilating_fun_image_strict[OF assms] have ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma ticks_as_often_left:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπcard {p. n ‚â§ p ‚àß p < m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f p) c)}
          = card {p. f n ‚â§ p ‚àß p < f m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) p c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπcard ?SET = card ?IMG‚Ä∫)
proof -
  from dilating_fun_injects[OF assms] have ‚Äπinj_on f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite ?SET‚Ä∫ by simp
  from inj_on_iff_eq_card[OF this] calculation
    have ‚Äπcard (image f ?SET) = card ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from dilating_fun_image_left[OF assms] have ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma ticks_as_often_right:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπcard {p. n < p ‚àß p ‚â§ m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f p) c)}
          = card {p. f n < p ‚àß p ‚â§ f m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) p c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπcard ?SET = card ?IMG‚Ä∫)
proof -
  from dilating_fun_injects[OF assms] have ‚Äπinj_on f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite ?SET‚Ä∫ by simp
  from inj_on_iff_eq_card[OF this] calculation
    have ‚Äπcard (image f ?SET) = card ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from dilating_fun_image_right[OF assms] have ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma ticks_as_often:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπcard {p. n ‚â§ p ‚àß p ‚â§ m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f p) c)}
          = card {p. f n ‚â§ p ‚àß p ‚â§ f m ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) p c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπcard ?SET = card ?IMG‚Ä∫)
proof -
  from dilating_fun_injects[OF assms] have ‚Äπinj_on f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite ?SET‚Ä∫ by simp
  from inj_on_iff_eq_card[OF this] calculation
    have ‚Äπcard (image f ?SET) = card ?SET‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from dilating_fun_image[OF assms] have ‚Äπ?IMG = image f ?SET‚Ä∫ .
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

text ‚ÄπThe date of an event is preserved by dilation.‚Ä∫

lemma ticks_tag_image:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπ‚àÉc. hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) k c) = œÑ‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k ‚àß time ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c) = œÑ‚Ä∫
proof -
  from ticks_image_sub'[OF assms(1,2)] have ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ .
  from this obtain k‚á©0 where ‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover with assms(1,3) have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c) = œÑ‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: dilating_def) 
  ultimately show ?thesis by blast
qed

text ‚ÄπTESL operators are invariant by dilation.‚Ä∫

lemma ticks_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) n a) = hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f n) a)‚Ä∫
using assms by (simp add: dilating_def)

lemma no_tick_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ(‚àÑn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n) ‚ü∂ ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) n a)‚Ä∫
using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast

text ‚ÄπLifting a total function to a partial function on an option domain.‚Ä∫

definition opt_lift::‚Äπ('a ‚áí 'a) ‚áí ('a option ‚áí 'a option)‚Ä∫
where
  ‚Äπopt_lift f ‚â° Œªx. case x of None ‚áí None | Some y ‚áí Some (f y)‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  The set of instants when a clock ticks in a dilated run is the image by the 
  dilation function of the set of instants when it ticks in the subrun.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_set_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{k. hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)} = image f {k. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπ?R = image f ?S‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà ?R‚Ä∫
    with no_tick_sub[OF assms] have ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
    from this obtain k‚á©0 where k0prop:‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
    with ticks_sub[OF assms] h have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with k0prop have ‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?S‚Ä∫ by blast
  }
  thus ‚Äπ?R ‚äÜ image f ?S‚Ä∫ by blast
next
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπk ‚àà image f ?S‚Ä∫
    from this obtain k‚á©0 where ‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with assms have ‚Äπk ‚àà ?R‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub by blast 
  }
  thus ‚Äπimage f ?S ‚äÜ ?R‚Ä∫ by blast
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Strictly monotonous functions preserve the least element.
‚Ä∫
lemma Least_strict_mono:
  assumes ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπ‚àÉx ‚àà S. ‚àÄy ‚àà S. x ‚â§ y‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ(LEAST y. y ‚àà f ` S) = f (LEAST x. x ‚àà S)‚Ä∫
using Least_mono[OF strict_mono_mono, OF assms] .

text ‚Äπ
  A non empty set of @{typ nat}s has a least element.
‚Ä∫
lemma Least_nat_ex:
  ‚Äπ(n::nat) ‚àà S ‚üπ ‚àÉx ‚àà S. (‚àÄy ‚àà S. x ‚â§ y)‚Ä∫
by (induction n rule: nat_less_induct, insert not_le_imp_less, blast)

text ‚Äπ  
  The first instant when a clock ticks in a dilated run is the image by the dilation
  function of the first instant when it ticks in the subrun.
‚Ä∫
lemma Least_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπ‚àÉk::nat. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ(LEAST k. k ‚àà {t. hamlet ((Rep_run r) t c)})
              = f (LEAST k. k ‚àà {t. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) t c)})‚Ä∫
          (is ‚Äπ(LEAST k. k ‚àà ?R) = f (LEAST k. k ‚àà ?S)‚Ä∫)
proof -
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπ‚àÉx. x ‚àà ?S‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence least:‚Äπ‚àÉx ‚àà ?S. ‚àÄy ‚àà ?S. x ‚â§ y‚Ä∫
    using Least_nat_ex ..
  from assms(1) have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  from Least_strict_mono[OF this least] have
    ‚Äπ(LEAST y. y ‚àà f ` ?S)  = f (LEAST x. x ‚àà ?S)‚Ä∫ .
  with tick_set_sub[OF assms(1), of ‚Äπc‚Ä∫] show ?thesis by auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  If a clock ticks in a run, it ticks in the subrun.
‚Ä∫
lemma ticks_imp_ticks_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπ‚àÉk. hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(2) obtain k where ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫ by blast
  with ticks_image_sub[OF assms(1)] ticks_sub[OF assms(1)] show ?thesis by blast
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Stronger version: it ticks in the subrun and we know when.
‚Ä∫
lemma ticks_imp_ticks_subk:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫
proof -
  from no_tick_sub[OF assms(1)] assms(2) have ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
  from this obtain k‚á©0 where ‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover with ticks_sub[OF assms(1)] assms(2)
    have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) k‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis by blast
qed

text ‚Äπ
  A dilating function preserves the tick count on an interval for any clock.
‚Ä∫
lemma dilated_ticks_strict:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. f m < i ‚àß i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπ?RUN = image f ?SUB‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπm < i ‚àß i < n‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπf m < f i ‚àß f i < (f n)‚Ä∫ using assms
      by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_monoD strict_mono_less_eq)
    moreover from h have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub[OF assms] by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπf i ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫ by simp
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SUB ‚äÜ ?RUN‚Ä∫ by blast
next
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    from ticks_imp_ticks_subk[OF assms this]
      obtain i‚á©0 where i0prop:‚Äπf i‚á©0 = i ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with h have ‚Äπf m < f i‚á©0 ‚àß f i‚á©0 < f n‚Ä∫ by simp
    moreover have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπm < i‚á©0 ‚àß i‚á©0 < n‚Ä∫
      using strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by blast
    with i0prop have ‚Äπ‚àÉi‚á©0. f i‚á©0 = i ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?RUN ‚äÜ image f ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
qed

lemma dilated_ticks_left:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. f m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπ?RUN = image f ?SUB‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπm ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπf m ‚â§ f i ‚àß f i < (f n)‚Ä∫ using assms
      by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_monoD strict_mono_less_eq)
    moreover from h have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub[OF assms] by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπf i ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫ by simp
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SUB ‚äÜ ?RUN‚Ä∫ by blast
next
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    from ticks_imp_ticks_subk[OF assms this]
      obtain i‚á©0 where i0prop:‚Äπf i‚á©0 = i ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with h have ‚Äπf m ‚â§ f i‚á©0 ‚àß f i‚á©0 < f n‚Ä∫ by simp
    moreover have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπm ‚â§ i‚á©0 ‚àß i‚á©0 < n‚Ä∫
      using strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by blast
    with i0prop have ‚Äπ‚àÉi‚á©0. f i‚á©0 = i ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?RUN ‚äÜ image f ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
qed

lemma dilated_ticks_right:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. f m < i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. m < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπ?RUN = image f ?SUB‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix i  assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπm < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπf m < f i ‚àß f i ‚â§ (f n)‚Ä∫ using assms
      by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_monoD strict_mono_less_eq)
    moreover from h have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub[OF assms] by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπf i ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫ by simp
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SUB ‚äÜ ?RUN‚Ä∫ by blast
next
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    from ticks_imp_ticks_subk[OF assms this]
      obtain i‚á©0 where i0prop:‚Äπf i‚á©0 = i ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with h have ‚Äπf m < f i‚á©0 ‚àß f i‚á©0 ‚â§ f n‚Ä∫ by simp
    moreover have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπm < i‚á©0 ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
      using strict_mono_less strict_mono_less_eq by blast
    with i0prop have ‚Äπ‚àÉi‚á©0. f i‚á©0 = i ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?RUN ‚äÜ image f ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
qed

lemma dilated_ticks:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. f m ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    (is ‚Äπ?RUN = image f ?SUB‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπm ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπf m ‚â§ f i ‚àß f i ‚â§ (f n)‚Ä∫
      using assms by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less_eq)
    moreover from h have ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub[OF assms] by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπf i ‚àà?RUN‚Ä∫ by simp
  } thus ‚Äπimage f ?SUB ‚äÜ ?RUN‚Ä∫ by blast
next
  { fix i assume h:‚Äπi ‚àà ?RUN‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫ by simp
    from ticks_imp_ticks_subk[OF assms this]
      obtain i‚á©0 where i0prop:‚Äπf i‚á©0 = i ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i‚á©0 c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    with h have ‚Äπf m ‚â§ f i‚á©0 ‚àß f i‚á©0 ‚â§ f n‚Ä∫ by simp
    moreover have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
    ultimately have ‚Äπm ‚â§ i‚á©0 ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ using strict_mono_less_eq by blast
    with i0prop have ‚Äπ‚àÉi‚á©0. f i‚á©0 = i ‚àß i‚á©0 ‚àà ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
  } thus ‚Äπ?RUN ‚äÜ image f ?SUB‚Ä∫ by blast
qed


text ‚Äπ
  No tick can occur in a dilated run before the image of 0 by the dilation function.
‚Ä∫

lemma empty_dilated_prefix:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  and     ‚Äπn < f 0‚Ä∫
shows   ‚Äπ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c)‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have False by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  thus ?thesis ..
qed

corollary empty_dilated_prefix':
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. f 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
         = {i. i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  hence ‚Äπf 0 ‚â§ f n‚Ä∫ unfolding strict_mono_def by (simp add: less_mono_imp_le_mono)
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄi. i ‚â§ f n = (i < f 0) ‚à® (f 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n)‚Ä∫ by auto
  hence ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        = {i. i < f 0 ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        ‚à™ {i. f 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
    by auto
  also have ‚Äπ... = {i. f 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
     using empty_dilated_prefix[OF assms] by blast
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

corollary dilated_prefix:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπ{i. 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        = image f {i. 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using dilated_ticks[OF assms] empty_dilated_prefix'[OF assms] by blast
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

corollary dilated_strict_prefix:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  shows   ‚Äπ{i. i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
          = image f {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have dil:‚Äπdilating_fun f r‚Ä∫ unfolding dilating_def by simp
  from dil have f0:‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫  using dilating_fun_def by blast
  from dilating_fun_image_left[OF dil, of ‚Äπ0‚Ä∫ ‚Äπn‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫]
  have ‚Äπ{i. f 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        = image f {i. 0 ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)}‚Ä∫ .
  hence ‚Äπ{i. i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        = image f {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f i) c)}‚Ä∫
    using f0 by simp
  also have ‚Äπ... = image f {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using assms dilating_def by blast
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

text‚ÄπA singleton of @{typ nat} can be defined with a weaker property.‚Ä∫ 
lemma nat_sing_prop:
  ‚Äπ{i::nat. i = k ‚àß P(i)} = {i::nat. i = k ‚àß P(k)}‚Ä∫
by auto

text ‚Äπ
  The set definition and the function definition of @{const tick_count}
  are equivalent.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_is_fun[code]:‚Äπtick_count r c n = run_tick_count r c n‚Ä∫
proof (induction n)
  case 0
    have ‚Äπtick_count r c 0 = card {i. i ‚â§ 0 ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: tick_count_def)
    also have ‚Äπ... = card {i::nat. i = 0 ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) 0 c)}‚Ä∫
      using le_zero_eq nat_sing_prop[of ‚Äπ0‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπŒªi. hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫] by simp
    also have ‚Äπ... = (if hamlet ((Rep_run r) 0 c) then 1 else 0)‚Ä∫ by simp
    also have ‚Äπ... = run_tick_count r c 0‚Ä∫ by simp
    finally show ?case .
next
  case (Suc k)
    show ?case
    proof (cases ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc k) c)‚Ä∫)
      case True
        hence ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ Suc k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
             = insert (Suc k) {i. i ‚â§ k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫ by auto
        hence ‚Äπtick_count r c (Suc k) = Suc (tick_count r c k)‚Ä∫
          by (simp add: tick_count_def)
        with Suc.IH have ‚Äπtick_count r c (Suc k) = Suc (run_tick_count r c k)‚Ä∫ by simp
        thus ?thesis by (simp add: True)
    next
      case False
        hence ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ Suc k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
             = {i. i ‚â§ k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
          using le_Suc_eq by auto
        hence ‚Äπtick_count r c (Suc k) = tick_count r c k‚Ä∫
          by (simp add: tick_count_def)
        thus ?thesis using Suc.IH by (simp add: False)
    qed
qed

text ‚Äπ
  To show that the set definition and the function definition 
  of @{const tick_count_strict} are equivalent, we first show that
  the ‚àó‚Äπstrictness‚Ä∫ of @{const tick_count_strict} can be softened using @{const Suc}.
‚Ä∫ 
lemma tick_count_strict_suc:‚Äπtick_count_strict r c (Suc n) = tick_count r c n‚Ä∫
  unfolding tick_count_def tick_count_strict_def using less_Suc_eq_le by auto

lemma tick_count_strict_is_fun[code]:
  ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c n = run_tick_count_strictly r c n‚Ä∫
proof (cases ‚Äπn = 0‚Ä∫)
  case True
    hence ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c n = 0‚Ä∫ unfolding tick_count_strict_def by simp
    also have ‚Äπ... = run_tick_count_strictly r c 0‚Ä∫
      using run_tick_count_strictly.simps(1)[symmetric] .
    finally show ?thesis using True by simp
next
  case False
    from not0_implies_Suc[OF this] obtain m where *:‚Äπn = Suc m‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c n = tick_count r c m‚Ä∫
      using tick_count_strict_suc by simp
    also have ‚Äπ... = run_tick_count r c m‚Ä∫ using tick_count_is_fun[of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫ ‚Äπm‚Ä∫] .
    also have ‚Äπ... = run_tick_count_strictly r c (Suc m)‚Ä∫
      using run_tick_count_strictly.simps(2)[symmetric] .
    finally show ?thesis using * by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  This leads to an alternate definition of the strict precedence relation.
‚Ä∫
lemma strictly_precedes_alt_def1:
  ‚Äπ{ œÅ. ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count œÅ K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly œÅ K‚á©1 n) }
 = { œÅ. ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count_strictly œÅ K‚á©2 (Suc n))
                  ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly œÅ K‚á©1 n) }‚Ä∫
by auto

text ‚Äπ
  The strict precedence relation can even be defined using 
  only @{const ‚Äπrun_tick_count‚Ä∫}:
‚Ä∫
lemma zero_gt_all:
  assumes ‚ÄπP (0::nat)‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπ‚ãÄn. n > 0 ‚üπ P n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚ÄπP n‚Ä∫
  using assms neq0_conv by blast

lemma strictly_precedes_alt_def2:
  ‚Äπ{ œÅ. ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count œÅ K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly œÅ K‚á©1 n) }
 = { œÅ. (¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run œÅ) 0 K‚á©2))
      ‚àß (‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count œÅ K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (run_tick_count œÅ K‚á©1 n)) }‚Ä∫
  (is ‚Äπ?P = ?P'‚Ä∫)
proof
  { fix r::‚Äπ'a run‚Ä∫
    assume ‚Äπr ‚àà ?P‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count r K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      by simp
    hence 1:‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count r K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      using tick_count_is_fun[symmetric, of r] tick_count_strict_is_fun[symmetric, of r]
      by simp
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count_strict r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      using tick_count_strict_suc[symmetric, of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπK‚á©2‚Ä∫] by simp
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count_strict r K‚á©2 (Suc (Suc n))) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 (Suc n))‚Ä∫
      by simp
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      using tick_count_strict_suc[symmetric, of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫] by simp
    hence *:‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (run_tick_count r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun)
    from 1 have ‚Äπtick_count r K‚á©2 0 <= tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 0‚Ä∫ by simp
    moreover have ‚Äπtick_count_strict r K‚á©1 0 = 0‚Ä∫ unfolding tick_count_strict_def by simp
    ultimately have ‚Äπtick_count r K‚á©2 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) 0 K‚á©2)‚Ä∫ unfolding tick_count_def by auto
    with * have ‚Äπr ‚àà ?P'‚Ä∫ by simp
  } thus ‚Äπ?P ‚äÜ ?P'‚Ä∫ ..
  { fix r::‚Äπ'a run‚Ä∫
    assume h:‚Äπr ‚àà ?P'‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (run_tick_count r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun) 
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count r K‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 (Suc n))‚Ä∫
      using tick_count_strict_suc[symmetric, of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπK‚á©1‚Ä∫] by simp
    hence *:‚Äπ‚àÄn. n > 0 ‚ü∂ (tick_count r K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      using gr0_implies_Suc by blast
    have ‚Äπtick_count_strict r K‚á©1 0 = 0‚Ä∫ unfolding tick_count_strict_def by simp
    moreover from h have ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) 0 K‚á©2)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπtick_count r K‚á©2 0 = 0‚Ä∫ unfolding tick_count_def by auto
    ultimately have ‚Äπtick_count r K‚á©2 0 ‚â§ tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 0‚Ä∫ by simp
    from zero_gt_all[of ‚ÄπŒªn. tick_count r K‚á©2 n ‚â§ tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 n‚Ä∫, OF this ] *
      have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. (tick_count r K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (tick_count_strict r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. (run_tick_count r K‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly r K‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun tick_count_strict_is_fun)
    hence ‚Äπr ‚àà ?P‚Ä∫ ..
  } thus ‚Äπ?P' ‚äÜ ?P‚Ä∫ ..
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Some properties of @{const ‚Äπrun_tick_count‚Ä∫}, @{const ‚Äπtick_count‚Ä∫} 
  and @{const ‚ÄπSuc‚Ä∫}:
‚Ä∫
lemma run_tick_count_suc:
  ‚Äπrun_tick_count r c (Suc n) = (if hamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c)
                                 then Suc (run_tick_count r c n)
                                 else run_tick_count r c n)‚Ä∫
by simp

corollary tick_count_suc:
  ‚Äπtick_count r c (Suc n) = (if hamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c)
                             then Suc (tick_count r c n)
                             else tick_count r c n)‚Ä∫
by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun)

text ‚Äπ
  Some generic properties on the cardinal of sets of nat that we will need later.
‚Ä∫
lemma card_suc:
  ‚Äπcard {i. i ‚â§ (Suc n) ‚àß P i} = card {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i} + card {i. i = (Suc n) ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i} ‚à© {i. i = (Suc n) ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i. i = (Suc n) ‚àß P i}
               = {i. i ‚â§ (Suc n) ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i = (Suc n) ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using card_Un_disjoint[of ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ ‚Äπ{i. i = Suc n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫] by simp
qed

lemma card_le_leq:
  assumes ‚Äπm < n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπcard {i::nat. m < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}
         = card {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i} + card {i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπ{i::nat. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i} ‚à© {i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover with assms have
    ‚Äπ{i::nat. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {i. m < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
  by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using card_Un_disjoint[of ‚Äπ{i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ ‚Äπ{i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫] by simp
qed

lemma card_le_leq_0:
  ‚Äπcard {i::nat. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i} = card {i. i < n ‚àß P i} + card {i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπ{i::nat. i < n ‚àß P i} ‚à© {i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπ{i. i < n ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using card_Un_disjoint[of ‚Äπ{i. i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ ‚Äπ{i. i = n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫] by simp
qed

lemma card_mnm:
  assumes ‚Äπm < n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπcard {i::nat. i < n ‚àß P i}
         = card {i. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} + card {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have 1:‚Äπ{i::nat. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} ‚à© {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by auto
  from assms have ‚Äπ‚àÄi::nat. i < n = (i ‚â§ m) ‚à® (m < i ‚àß i < n)‚Ä∫
    using less_trans by auto
  hence 2:
    ‚Äπ{i::nat. i < n ‚àß P i} = {i. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by blast
  have 3:‚Äπfinite {i. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  have 4:‚Äπfinite {i. m < i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  from card_Un_disjoint[OF 3 4 1] 2 show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma card_mnm':
  assumes ‚Äπm < n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπcard {i::nat. i < n ‚àß P i}
         = card {i. i < m ‚àß P i} + card {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have 1:‚Äπ{i::nat. i < m ‚àß P i} ‚à© {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by auto
  from assms have ‚Äπ‚àÄi::nat. i < n = (i < m) ‚à® (m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n)‚Ä∫
    using less_trans by auto
  hence 2:
    ‚Äπ{i::nat. i < n ‚àß P i} = {i. i < m ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by blast
  have 3:‚Äπfinite {i. i < m ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  have 4:‚Äπfinite {i. m ‚â§ i ‚àß i < n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  from card_Un_disjoint[OF 3 4 1] 2 show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma nat_interval_union:
  assumes ‚Äπm ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπ{i::nat. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}
         = {i::nat. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} ‚à™ {i::nat. m < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
using assms le_cases nat_less_le by auto

lemma card_sing_prop:‚Äπcard {i. i = n ‚àß P i} = (if P n then 1 else 0)‚Ä∫
proof (cases ‚ÄπP n‚Ä∫)
  case True
    hence ‚Äπ{i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {n}‚Ä∫ by (simp add: Collect_conv_if)
    with ‚ÄπP n‚Ä∫ show ?thesis by simp
next
  case False
    hence ‚Äπ{i. i = n ‚àß P i} = {}‚Ä∫ by (simp add: Collect_conv_if)
    with ‚Äπ¬¨P n‚Ä∫ show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma card_prop_mono:
  assumes ‚Äπm ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπcard {i::nat. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} ‚â§ card {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ m ‚àß P i} ‚äÜ {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß P i}‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by (simp add: card_mono)
qed


text ‚Äπ
  In a dilated run, no tick occurs strictly between two successive instants that 
  are the images by @{term ‚Äπf‚Ä∫} of instants of the original run.
‚Ä∫
lemma no_tick_before_suc:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπ(f n) < k ‚àß k < (f (Suc n))‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  { fix k assume h:‚Äπf n < k ‚àß k < f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÉk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ using assms(1) dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
    from this obtain k‚á©0 where ‚Äπf k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫ by blast
    with h have ‚Äπf n < f k‚á©0 ‚àß f k‚á©0 < f (Suc n)‚Ä∫ by simp
    hence False using smf not_less_eq strict_mono_less by blast
  } thus ?thesis using assms(2) by blast
qed

text ‚Äπ
  From this, we show that the number of ticks on any clock at @{term ‚Äπf (Suc n)‚Ä∫}
  depends only on the number of ticks on this clock at @{term ‚Äπf n‚Ä∫} and whether
  this clock ticks at @{term ‚Äπf (Suc n)‚Ä∫}.
  All the instants in between are stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_fsuc:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count r c (f (Suc n))
         = tick_count r c (f n) + card {k. k = f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}‚Ä∫
proof -
  have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
  moreover have ‚Äπfinite {k. k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}‚Ä∫ by simp
  moreover have *:‚Äπfinite {k. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately have ‚Äπ{k. k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)} =
                        {k. k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
                      ‚à™ {k. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: nat_interval_union strict_mono_less_eq)
  moreover have ‚Äπ{k. k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}
                  ‚à© {k. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)} = {}‚Ä∫
     by auto
  ultimately have ‚Äπcard {k. k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet (Rep_run r k c)} =
                      card {k. k ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet (Rep_run r k c)}
                    + card {k. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet (Rep_run r k c)}‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: * card_Un_disjoint)
  moreover from no_tick_before_suc[OF assms] have
    ‚Äπ{k. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)} =
            {k. k = f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)}‚Ä∫
    using smf strict_mono_less by fastforce
  ultimately show ?thesis by (simp add: tick_count_def)
qed

corollary tick_count_f_suc:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count r c (f (Suc n))
         = tick_count r c (f n) + (if hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f (Suc n)) c) then 1 else 0)‚Ä∫
using tick_count_fsuc[OF assms]
      card_sing_prop[of ‚Äπf (Suc n)‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπŒªk. hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫] by simp

corollary tick_count_f_suc_suc:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count r c (f (Suc n)) = (if hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f (Suc n)) c)
                                         then Suc (tick_count r c (f n))
                                         else tick_count r c (f n))‚Ä∫
using tick_count_f_suc[OF assms] by simp

lemma tick_count_f_suc_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count r c (f (Suc n)) = (if hamlet ((Rep_run sub) (Suc n) c)
                                         then Suc (tick_count r c (f n))
                                         else tick_count r c (f n))‚Ä∫
using tick_count_f_suc_suc[OF assms] assms by (simp add: dilating_def)

text ‚Äπ
  The number of ticks does not progress during stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_latest:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf n‚á©p < n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count r c n = tick_count r c (f n‚á©p)‚Ä∫
proof -
  have union:‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)} =
          {i. i ‚â§ f n‚á©p ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        ‚à™ {i. f n‚á©p < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫ using assms(2) by auto
  have partition: ‚Äπ{i. i ‚â§ f n‚á©p ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
        ‚à© {i. f n‚á©p < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)} = {}‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: disjoint_iff_not_equal)
  from assms have ‚Äπ{i. f n‚á©p < i ‚àß i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)} = {}‚Ä∫
    using no_tick_sub by fastforce
  with union and partition show ?thesis by (simp add: tick_count_def)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We finally show that the number of ticks on any clock is preserved by dilation.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count sub c n = tick_count r c (f n)‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπtick_count sub c n = card {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using tick_count_def[of ‚Äπsub‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫ ‚Äπn‚Ä∫] .
  also have ‚Äπ... = card (image f {i. i ‚â§ n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)})‚Ä∫
    using assms dilating_def dilating_injects[OF assms] by (simp add: card_image)
  also have ‚Äπ... = card {i. i ‚â§ f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using dilated_prefix[OF assms, symmetric, of ‚Äπn‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫] by simp
  also have ‚Äπ... = tick_count r c (f n)‚Ä∫
    using tick_count_def[of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫ ‚Äπf n‚Ä∫] by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

corollary run_tick_count_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπrun_tick_count sub c n = run_tick_count r c (f n)‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπrun_tick_count sub c n = tick_count sub c n‚Ä∫
    using tick_count_is_fun[of ‚Äπsub‚Ä∫ c n, symmetric] .
  also from tick_count_sub[OF assms] have ‚Äπ... = tick_count r c (f n)‚Ä∫ .
  also have ‚Äπ... = #‚á©‚â§ r c (f n)‚Ä∫ using tick_count_is_fun[of r c ‚Äπf n‚Ä∫] .
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The number of ticks occurring strictly before the first instant is null.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_strict_0:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c (f 0) = 0‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have ‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  thus ?thesis unfolding tick_count_strict_def by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The number of ticks strictly before an instant does not progress
  during stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_strict_stable:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
  assumes ‚Äπ(f n) < k ‚àß k < (f (Suc n))‚Ä∫
  shows ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c k = tick_count_strict r c (f (Suc n))‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπf n < k‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄi. k ‚â§ i ‚ü∂ f n < i‚Ä∫ by simp
  with no_tick_before_suc[OF assms(1)] have
    *:‚Äπ‚àÄi. k ‚â§ i ‚àß i < f (Suc n) ‚ü∂ ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)‚Ä∫ by blast
  from tick_count_strict_def have
    ‚Äπtick_count_strict r c (f (Suc n)) = card {i. i < f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫ .
  also have
    ‚Äπ... = card {i. i < k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}
         + card {i. k ‚â§ i ‚àß i < f (Suc n) ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫ 
    using card_mnm' assms(2) by simp
  also have ‚Äπ... = card {i. i < k ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫ using * by simp
  finally show ?thesis by (simp add: tick_count_strict_def)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Finally, the number of ticks strictly before an instant is preserved by dilation.
‚Ä∫
lemma tick_count_strict_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtick_count_strict sub c n = tick_count_strict r c (f n)‚Ä∫
proof -
  have ‚Äπtick_count_strict sub c n = card {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using tick_count_strict_def[of ‚Äπsub‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫ ‚Äπn‚Ä∫] .
  also have ‚Äπ... = card (image f {i. i < n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) i c)})‚Ä∫
    using assms dilating_def dilating_injects[OF assms] by (simp add: card_image)
  also have ‚Äπ... = card {i. i < f n ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) i c)}‚Ä∫
    using dilated_strict_prefix[OF assms, symmetric, of ‚Äπn‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫] by simp
  also have ‚Äπ... = tick_count_strict r c (f n)‚Ä∫
    using tick_count_strict_def[of ‚Äπr‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚Ä∫ ‚Äπf n‚Ä∫] by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The tick count on any clock can only increase.
‚Ä∫

lemma mono_tick_count:
  ‚Äπmono (Œª k. tick_count r c k)‚Ä∫
proof
  { fix x y::nat
    assume ‚Äπx ‚â§ y‚Ä∫
    from card_prop_mono[OF this] have ‚Äπtick_count r c x ‚â§ tick_count r c y‚Ä∫
      unfolding tick_count_def by simp
  } thus ‚Äπ‚ãÄx y. x ‚â§ y ‚üπ tick_count r c x ‚â§ tick_count r c y‚Ä∫ .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  In a dilated run, for any stuttering instant, there is an instant which is the 
  image of an instant in the original run, and which is the latest one before
  the stuttering instant.
‚Ä∫
lemma greatest_prev_image:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπ(‚àÑn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n) ‚üπ (‚àÉn‚á©p. f n‚á©p < n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k)))‚Ä∫
proof (induction n)
  case 0
    with assms have ‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
    thus ?case using "0.prems" by blast
next
  case (Suc n)
  show ?case
  proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫)
    case True
      from this obtain n‚á©0 where ‚Äπf n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫ by blast
      hence ‚Äπf n‚á©0 < (Suc n) ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©0 < k ‚àß k ‚â§ (Suc n) ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫
        using Suc.prems Suc_leI le_antisym by blast
      thus ?thesis by blast
  next
    case False
    from Suc.IH[OF this] obtain n‚á©p
      where ‚Äπf n‚á©p < n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπf n‚á©p < Suc n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫ by simp
    with Suc(2) have ‚Äπf n‚á©p < (Suc n) ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ (Suc n) ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫
      using le_Suc_eq by auto
    thus ?thesis by blast
  qed
qed

text ‚Äπ
  If a strictly monotonous function on @{typ ‚Äπnat‚Ä∫} increases only by one,
  its argument was increased only by one.
‚Ä∫
lemma strict_mono_suc:
  assumes ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf sn = Suc (f n)‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπsn = Suc n‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπf sn > f n‚Ä∫ by simp
  with strict_mono_less[OF assms(1)] have ‚Äπsn > n‚Ä∫ by simp
  moreover have ‚Äπsn ‚â§ Suc n‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { assume ‚Äπsn > Suc n‚Ä∫
      from this obtain i where ‚Äπn < i ‚àß i < sn‚Ä∫ by blast
      hence ‚Äπf n < f i ‚àß f i < f sn‚Ä∫ using assms(1) by (simp add: strict_mono_def)
      with assms(2) have False by simp
    } thus ?thesis using not_less by blast
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis by (simp add: Suc_leI)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Two successive non stuttering instants of a dilated run are the images
  of two successive instants of the original run.
‚Ä∫
lemma next_non_stuttering:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf n‚á©p < n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf sn‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπsn‚á©0 = Suc n‚á©p‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  from assms(2) have *:‚Äπ‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k < Suc n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k)‚Ä∫ by simp
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπf n‚á©p < n‚Ä∫ by simp
  with smf assms(3) have **:‚Äπsn‚á©0 > n‚á©p‚Ä∫ using strict_mono_less by fastforce
  have ‚ÄπSuc n ‚â§ f (Suc n‚á©p)‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { assume h:‚ÄπSuc n > f (Suc n‚á©p)‚Ä∫
      hence ‚ÄπSuc n‚á©p < sn‚á©0‚Ä∫ using ** Suc_lessI assms(3) by fastforce
      hence ‚Äπ‚àÉk. k > n‚á©p ‚àß f k < Suc n‚Ä∫ using h by blast
      with * have False using smf strict_mono_less by blast
    } thus ?thesis using not_less by blast
  qed
  hence ‚Äπsn‚á©0 ‚â§ Suc n‚á©p‚Ä∫ using assms(3) smf using strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
  with ** show ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The order relation between tick counts on clocks is preserved by dilation.
‚Ä∫
lemma dil_tick_count:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπ‚àÄn. run_tick_count sub a n ‚â§ run_tick_count sub b n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπrun_tick_count r a n ‚â§ run_tick_count r b n‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  show ?thesis
  proof (induction n)
    case 0 
      from assms(2) have ‚Äπrun_tick_count sub a 0 ‚â§ run_tick_count sub b 0‚Ä∫ ..
      with run_tick_count_sub[OF *, of _ 0] have
        ‚Äπrun_tick_count r a (f 0) ‚â§ run_tick_count r b (f 0)‚Ä∫ by simp
      moreover from * have ‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by (simp add:dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
      ultimately show ?case by simp
  next
    case (Suc n') thus ?case 
    proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = Suc n'‚Ä∫)
      case True
        from this obtain n‚á©0 where fn0:‚Äπf n‚á©0 = Suc n'‚Ä∫ by blast
        show ?thesis
        proof (cases ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 a)‚Ä∫)
          case True
            have ‚Äπrun_tick_count r a (f n‚á©0) ‚â§ run_tick_count r b (f n‚á©0)‚Ä∫
              using assms(2) run_tick_count_sub[OF *] by simp
            thus ?thesis by (simp add: fn0)
        next
          case False
            hence ‚Äπ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc n') a)‚Ä∫
              using * fn0 ticks_sub by fastforce
            thus ?thesis by (simp add: Suc.IH le_SucI)
        qed
    next
      case False
        thus ?thesis  using * Suc.IH no_tick_sub by fastforce
    qed
  qed
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Time does not progress during stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma stutter_no_time:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπ‚ãÄk. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ m ‚üπ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k)‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπm > f n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) m c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have ‚Äπ‚àÄk. k < m - (f n) ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = Suc ((f n) + k))‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄk. k < m - (f n)
            ‚ü∂ time ((Rep_run r) (Suc ((f n) + k)) c) = time ((Rep_run r) ((f n) + k) c)‚Ä∫
    using assms(1) by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  hence *:‚Äπ‚àÄk. k < m - (f n) ‚ü∂ time ((Rep_run r) (Suc ((f n) + k)) c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫
    using bounded_suc_ind[of ‚Äπm - (f n)‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπŒªk. time (Rep_run r k c)‚Ä∫ ‚Äπf n‚Ä∫] by blast
  from assms(3) obtain m‚á©0 where m0:‚ÄπSuc m‚á©0 = m - (f n)‚Ä∫ using Suc_diff_Suc by blast
  with * have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) (Suc ((f n) + m‚á©0)) c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫ by auto
  moreover from m0 have ‚ÄπSuc ((f n) + m‚á©0) = m‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma time_stuttering:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) n c) = œÑ‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπ‚ãÄk. f n < k ‚àß k ‚â§ m ‚üπ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k)‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπm > f n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) m c) = œÑ‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(3) have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) m c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫
    using  stutter_no_time[OF assms(1,3,4)] by blast
  also from assms(1,2) have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) (f n) c) = œÑ‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The first instant at which a given date is reached on a clock is preserved
  by dilation.
‚Ä∫
lemma first_time_image:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπfirst_time sub c n t = first_time r c (f n) t‚Ä∫
proof
  assume ‚Äπfirst_time sub c n t‚Ä∫
  with before_first_time[OF this]
    have *:‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) n c) = t ‚àß (‚àÄm < n. time((Rep_run sub) m c) < t)‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: first_time_def)
  moreover have ‚Äπ‚àÄn c. time (Rep_run sub n c) = time (Rep_run r (f n) c)‚Ä∫
      using assms(1) by (simp add: dilating_def)
  ultimately have **:
    ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) (f n) c) = t ‚àß (‚àÄm < n. time((Rep_run r) (f m) c) < t)‚Ä∫
    by simp
  have ‚Äπ‚àÄm < f n. time ((Rep_run r) m c) < t‚Ä∫
  proof -
  { fix m assume hyp:‚Äπm < f n‚Ä∫
    have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) m c) < t‚Ä∫
    proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉm‚á©0. f m‚á©0 = m‚Ä∫)
      case True
        from this obtain m‚á©0 where mm0:‚Äπm = f m‚á©0‚Ä∫ by blast
        with hyp have m0n:‚Äπm‚á©0 < n‚Ä∫ using assms(1)
          by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less)
        hence ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) m‚á©0 c) < t‚Ä∫ using * by blast
        thus ?thesis by (simp add: mm0 m0n **)
    next
      case False
        hence ‚Äπ‚àÉm‚á©p. f m‚á©p < m ‚àß (‚àÄk. f m‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ m ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫
          using greatest_prev_image[OF assms] by simp
        from this obtain m‚á©p where
          mp:‚Äπf m‚á©p < m ‚àß (‚àÄk. f m‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ m ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫ by blast
        hence ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) m c) = time ((Rep_run sub) m‚á©p c)‚Ä∫
          using time_stuttering[OF assms] by blast
        also from hyp mp have ‚Äπf m‚á©p < f n‚Ä∫ by linarith
        hence ‚Äπm‚á©p < n‚Ä∫ using assms
          by (simp add:dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less)
        hence ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) m‚á©p c) < t‚Ä∫ using * by simp
        finally show ?thesis by simp
      qed
    } thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  with ** show ‚Äπfirst_time r c (f n) t‚Ä∫ by (simp add: alt_first_time_def)
next
  assume ‚Äπfirst_time r c (f n) t‚Ä∫
  hence *:‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) (f n) c) = t ‚àß (‚àÄk < f n. time ((Rep_run r) k c) < t)‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: first_time_def before_first_time)
  hence ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) n c) = t‚Ä∫ using assms dilating_def by blast
  moreover from * have ‚Äπ(‚àÄk < n. time ((Rep_run sub) k c) < t)‚Ä∫
    using assms dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_monoD by fastforce
  ultimately show ‚Äπfirst_time sub c n t‚Ä∫ by (simp add: alt_first_time_def)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The first instant of a dilated run is necessarily the image of the first instant
  of the original run.
‚Ä∫
lemma first_dilated_instant:
  assumes ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf (0::nat) = (0::nat)‚Ä∫
    shows ‚ÄπMax {i. f i ‚â§ 0} = 0‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπ‚àÄn > 0. f n > 0‚Ä∫ using strict_monoD[OF assms(1)] by force
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn ‚â† 0. ¬¨(f n ‚â§ 0)‚Ä∫ by simp
  with assms(2) have ‚Äπ{i. f i ‚â§ 0} = {0}‚Ä∫ by blast
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  For any instant @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} of a dilated run, let @{term ‚Äπn‚á©0‚Ä∫} be the last 
  instant before @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} that is the image of an original instant. All instants
  strictly after @{term ‚Äπn‚á©0‚Ä∫} and before @{term ‚Äπn‚Ä∫} are stuttering instants.
‚Ä∫
lemma not_image_stut:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπn‚á©0 = Max {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπf n‚á©0 < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπ‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫
                and fxge:‚Äπ‚àÄx. f x ‚â• x‚Ä∫
    by (auto simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  have finite_prefix:‚Äπfinite {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫ by (simp add: finite_less_ub fxge)
  from assms(1) have ‚Äπf 0 ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  hence ‚Äπ{i. f i ‚â§ n} ‚â† {}‚Ä∫ by blast
  from assms(3) fxge have ‚Äπf n‚á©0 < n‚Ä∫ by linarith
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπ‚àÄx > n‚á©0. f x > n‚Ä∫ using Max.coboundedI[OF finite_prefix]
    using not_le by auto
  with assms(3) strict_mono_less[OF smf] show ?thesis by auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  For any dilating function @{term ‚Äπf‚Ä∫}, @{term ‚Äπdil_inverse f‚Ä∫} is a 
  contracting function.
‚Ä∫
lemma contracting_inverse:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπcontracting (dil_inverse f) r sub f‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms have smf:‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫
    and no_img_tick:‚Äπ‚àÄk. (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k) ‚ü∂ (‚àÄc. ¬¨(hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)))‚Ä∫
    and no_img_time:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. (‚àÑn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = (Suc n))
                          ‚ü∂ (‚àÄc. time ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c) = time ((Rep_run r) n c))‚Ä∫
    and fxge:‚Äπ‚àÄx. f x ‚â• x‚Ä∫ and f0n:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. f 0 ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ and f0:‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫
    by (auto simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  have finite_prefix:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. finite {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫ by (auto simp add: finite_less_ub fxge)
  have prefix_not_empty:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. {i. f i ‚â§ n} ‚â† {}‚Ä∫ using f0n by blast                

  have 1:‚Äπmono (dil_inverse f)‚Ä∫
  proof -
  { fix x::‚Äπnat‚Ä∫ and y::‚Äπnat‚Ä∫ assume hyp:‚Äπx ‚â§ y‚Ä∫
    hence inc:‚Äπ{i. f i ‚â§ x} ‚äÜ {i. f i ‚â§ y}‚Ä∫
      by (simp add: hyp Collect_mono le_trans)
    from Max_mono[OF inc prefix_not_empty finite_prefix]
      have ‚Äπ(dil_inverse f) x ‚â§ (dil_inverse f) y‚Ä∫ unfolding dil_inverse_def .
  } thus ?thesis unfolding mono_def by simp
  qed

  from first_dilated_instant[OF smf f0] have 2:‚Äπ(dil_inverse f) 0 = 0‚Ä∫
    unfolding dil_inverse_def .

  from fxge have ‚Äπ‚àÄn i. f i ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ i ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ using le_trans by blast
  hence 3:‚Äπ‚àÄn. (dil_inverse f) n ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ using Max_in[OF finite_prefix prefix_not_empty] 
    unfolding dil_inverse_def by blast

  from 1 2 3 have *:‚Äπcontracting_fun (dil_inverse f)‚Ä∫ by (simp add: contracting_fun_def)
  
  have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. finite {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫ by (simp add: finite_prefix)
  moreover have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. {i. f i ‚â§ n} ‚â† {}‚Ä∫ using prefix_not_empty by blast
  ultimately have 4:‚Äπ‚àÄn. f ((dil_inverse f) n) ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ 
    unfolding dil_inverse_def
    using assms(1) dilating_def dilating_fun_def Max_in by blast

  have 5:‚Äπ‚àÄn c k. f ((dil_inverse f) n) < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n
                              ‚ü∂ ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) k c)‚Ä∫
    using not_image_stut[OF assms] no_img_tick unfolding dil_inverse_def by blast

  have 6:‚Äπ(‚àÄn c k. f ((dil_inverse f) n) ‚â§ k ‚àß k ‚â§ n
                      ‚ü∂ time ((Rep_run r) k c) = time ((Rep_run sub) ((dil_inverse f) n) c))‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { fix n c k assume h:‚Äπf ((dil_inverse f) n) ‚â§ k ‚àß k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
      let ?œÑ = ‚Äπtime (Rep_run sub ((dil_inverse f) n) c)‚Ä∫
      have tau:‚Äπtime (Rep_run sub ((dil_inverse f) n) c) = ?œÑ‚Ä∫ ..
      have gn:‚Äπ(dil_inverse f) n = Max {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫ unfolding dil_inverse_def ..
      from time_stuttering[OF assms tau, of k] not_image_stut[OF assms gn]
      have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) k c) = time ((Rep_run sub) ((dil_inverse f) n) c)‚Ä∫
      proof (cases ‚Äπf ((dil_inverse f) n) = k‚Ä∫)
        case True
          moreover have ‚Äπ‚àÄn c. time (Rep_run sub n c) = time (Rep_run r (f n) c)‚Ä∫
            using assms by (simp add: dilating_def)
          ultimately show ?thesis by simp
      next
        case False
          with h have ‚Äπf (Max {i. f i ‚â§ n}) < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dil_inverse_def)
          with time_stuttering[OF assms tau, of k] not_image_stut[OF assms gn]
            show ?thesis unfolding dil_inverse_def by auto
      qed
    } thus ?thesis by simp
  qed

  from * 4 5 6 show ?thesis unfolding contracting_def by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The only possible contracting function toward a dense run (a run with no empty 
  instants) is the inverse of the dilating function as defined by 
  @{term ‚Äπdil_inverse‚Ä∫}.
‚Ä∫
lemma dense_run_dil_inverse_only:
  assumes ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπcontracting g r sub f‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπdense_run sub‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπg = (dil_inverse f)‚Ä∫
proof
  from assms(1) have *:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. finite {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫
    using finite_less_ub by (simp add:  dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  from assms(1) have ‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by (simp add:  dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
  hence ‚Äπ‚ãÄn. 0 ‚àà {i. f i ‚â§ n}‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence **:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. {i. f i ‚â§ n} ‚â† {}‚Ä∫ by blast
  { fix n assume h:‚Äπg n < (dil_inverse f) n‚Ä∫
    hence ‚Äπ‚àÉk > g n. f k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ unfolding dil_inverse_def using Max_in[OF * **] by blast
    from this obtain k where kprop:‚Äπg n < k ‚àß f k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ by blast
    with assms(3) dense_run_def obtain c where ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run sub) k c)‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)‚Ä∫ using ticks_sub[OF assms(1)] by blast
    moreover from kprop have ‚Äπf (g n) < f k ‚àß f k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫ using assms(1)
      by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_monoD)
    ultimately have False using assms(2) unfolding contracting_def by blast
  } hence 1:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. ¬¨(g n < (dil_inverse f) n)‚Ä∫ by blast
  { fix n assume h:‚Äπg n > (dil_inverse f) n‚Ä∫
    have ‚Äπ‚àÉk ‚â§ g n. f k > n‚Ä∫ 
    proof -
      { assume ‚Äπ‚àÄk ‚â§ g n. f k ‚â§ n‚Ä∫
        with h have False unfolding dil_inverse_def
        using Max_gr_iff[OF * **] by blast
      }
      thus ?thesis using not_less by blast
    qed
    from this obtain k where ‚Äπk ‚â§ g n ‚àß f k > n‚Ä∫ by blast
    hence ‚Äπf (g n) ‚â• f k ‚àß f k > n‚Ä∫ using assms(1)
      by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def strict_mono_less_eq)
    hence ‚Äπf (g n) > n‚Ä∫ by simp
    with assms(2) have False unfolding contracting_def by (simp add: leD)
  } hence 2:‚Äπ‚ãÄn. ¬¨(g n > (dil_inverse f) n)‚Ä∫ by blast
  from 1 2 show ‚Äπ‚ãÄn. g n = (dil_inverse f) n‚Ä∫ by (simp add: not_less_iff_gr_or_eq)
qed

end

Theory Stuttering

subsection‚ÄπMain Theorems‚Ä∫

theory Stuttering
imports StutteringLemmas

begin

text ‚Äπ
  Using the lemmas of the previous section about the invariance by stuttering
  of various properties of TESL specifications, we can now prove that the atomic 
  formulae that compose TESL specifications are invariant by stuttering.
‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπSporadic specifications are preserved in a dilated run.‚Ä∫
lemma sporadic_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶c sporadic œÑ on c'‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶c sporadic œÑ on c'‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f
    where ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn c. time ((Rep_run sub) n c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)
           ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n c) = hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def)
  moreover from assms(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà {r. ‚àÉ n. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c) ‚àß time ((Rep_run r) n c') = œÑ}‚Ä∫ by simp
  from this obtain k where ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) k c') = œÑ ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run sub) k c)‚Ä∫ by auto
  ultimately have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run r) (f k) c') = œÑ ‚àß hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f k) c)‚Ä∫ by simp
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

text ‚ÄπImplications are preserved in a dilated run.‚Ä∫
theorem implies_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 implies c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 implies c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from assms(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà {r. ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2)}‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©2)‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
    using ticks_imp_ticks_subk ticks_sub by blast
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem implies_not_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 implies not c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 implies not c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where ‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from assms(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà {r. ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2)}‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©2)‚Ä∫ by simp
  ultimately have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ ¬¨ hamlet ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
    using ticks_imp_ticks_subk ticks_sub by blast
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚ÄπPrecedence relations are preserved in a dilated run.‚Ä∫
theorem weakly_precedes_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 weakly precedes c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 weakly precedes c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  from assms(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà {r. ‚àÄn. (run_tick_count r c‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count r c‚á©1 n)}‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. (run_tick_count sub c‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count sub c‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫ by simp
  from dil_tick_count[OF assms(1) this]
    have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. (run_tick_count r c‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count r c‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫ by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem strictly_precedes_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 strictly precedes c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶c‚á©1 strictly precedes c‚á©2‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  from assms(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà { œÅ. ‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count œÅ c‚á©2 n) ‚â§ (run_tick_count_strictly œÅ c‚á©1 n) }‚Ä∫
  by simp
  with strictly_precedes_alt_def2[of ‚Äπc‚á©2‚Ä∫ ‚Äπc‚á©1‚Ä∫]  have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà { œÅ. (¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run œÅ) 0 c‚á©2))
  ‚àß (‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count œÅ c‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (run_tick_count œÅ c‚á©1 n)) }‚Ä∫
  by blast
  hence ‚Äπ(¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run sub) 0 c‚á©2))
       ‚àß (‚àÄn::nat. (run_tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (run_tick_count sub c‚á©1 n))‚Ä∫
    by simp
  hence
    1:‚Äπ(¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run sub) 0 c‚á©2))
     ‚àß (‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count sub c‚á©1 n))‚Ä∫
  by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun)
  have ‚Äπ‚àÄn::nat. (tick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n)) ‚â§ (tick_count r c‚á©1 n)‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { fix n::nat
      have ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) ‚â§ tick_count r c‚á©1 n‚Ä∫
      proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫)
        case True ‚Äï ‚Äπn is in the image of f‚Ä∫
          from this obtain n‚á©0 where fn:‚Äπf n‚á©0 = n‚Ä∫ by blast
          show ?thesis
          proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉsn‚á©0. f sn‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫)
            case True ‚Äï ‚ÄπSuc n is in the image of f‚Ä∫
              from this obtain sn‚á©0 where fsn:‚Äπf sn‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫ by blast
              with fn strict_mono_suc * have ‚Äπsn‚á©0 = Suc n‚á©0‚Ä∫
                using  dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
              with 1 have ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 sn‚á©0 ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©0‚Ä∫ by simp
              thus ?thesis using fn fsn tick_count_sub[OF *] by simp
          next
            case False ‚Äï ‚ÄπSuc n is not in the image of f‚Ä∫
              hence ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
                using * by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
              hence ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) = tick_count r c‚á©2 n‚Ä∫
                by (simp add: tick_count_suc)
              also have ‚Äπ... = tick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©0‚Ä∫
                using fn tick_count_sub[OF *] by simp
              finally have ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) = tick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©0‚Ä∫ .
              moreover have ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©0 ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©0)‚Ä∫
                by (simp add: tick_count_suc)
              ultimately have
                ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©0)‚Ä∫ by simp
              moreover have
                ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©0) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©0‚Ä∫ using 1 by simp
              ultimately have ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©0‚Ä∫ by simp
              thus ?thesis using tick_count_sub[OF *] fn by simp
          qed
      next
        case False ‚Äï ‚Äπn is not in the image of f‚Ä∫
          from greatest_prev_image[OF * this] obtain n‚á©p  where
            np_prop:‚Äπf n‚á©p < n ‚àß (‚àÄk. f n‚á©p < k ‚àß k ‚â§ n ‚ü∂ (‚àÑk‚á©0. f k‚á©0 = k))‚Ä∫ by blast
          from tick_count_latest[OF * this] have
            ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©1 n = tick_count r c‚á©1 (f n‚á©p)‚Ä∫ . 
          hence a:‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©1 n = tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©p‚Ä∫
            using tick_count_sub[OF *] by simp
          have b: ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©p) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ using 1 by simp
          show ?thesis
          proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉsn‚á©0. f sn‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫)
            case True ‚Äï ‚ÄπSuc n is in the image of f‚Ä∫
              from this obtain sn‚á©0 where fsn:‚Äπf sn‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫ by blast
              from next_non_stuttering[OF * np_prop this]  have sn_prop:‚Äπsn‚á©0 = Suc n‚á©p‚Ä∫ .
              with b have ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 sn‚á©0 ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ by simp
              thus ?thesis using tick_count_sub[OF *] fsn a by auto
          next
            case False ‚Äï ‚ÄπSuc n is not in the image of f‚Ä∫
              hence ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
                using * by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
              hence ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) = tick_count r c‚á©2 n‚Ä∫
                by (simp add: tick_count_suc)
              also have ‚Äπ... = tick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ using np_prop tick_count_sub[OF *]
                by (simp add: tick_count_latest[OF * np_prop])
              finally have ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) = tick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ .
              moreover have ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 n‚á©p ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©p)‚Ä∫
                by (simp add: tick_count_suc)
              ultimately have
                ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©p)‚Ä∫ by simp
              moreover have
                ‚Äπtick_count sub c‚á©2 (Suc n‚á©p) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ using 1 by simp
              ultimately have ‚Äπtick_count r c‚á©2 (Suc n) ‚â§ tick_count sub c‚á©1 n‚á©p‚Ä∫ by simp
              thus ?thesis using np_prop mono_tick_count  using a by linarith
          qed
      qed
    } thus ?thesis ..
  qed
  moreover from 1 have ‚Äπ¬¨hamlet ((Rep_run r) 0 c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
    using * empty_dilated_prefix ticks_sub by fastforce
  ultimately show ?thesis by (simp add: tick_count_is_fun strictly_precedes_alt_def2) 
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Time delayed relations are preserved in a dilated run.
‚Ä∫
theorem time_delayed_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ a time-delayed by Œ¥œÑ on ms implies b ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ a time-delayed by Œ¥œÑ on ms implies b ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  from assms(2) have ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run sub) n a)
                          ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm ‚â• n. first_time sub ms m (time ((Rep_run sub) n ms) + Œ¥œÑ)
                                       ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run sub) m b))‚Ä∫
    using TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(5)[of ‚Äπa‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπŒ¥œÑ‚Ä∫ ‚Äπms‚Ä∫ ‚Äπb‚Ä∫] by simp
  hence **:‚Äπ‚àÄn‚á©0. hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f n‚á©0) a)
                  ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm‚á©0 ‚â• n‚á©0. first_time r ms (f m‚á©0) (time ((Rep_run r) (f n‚á©0) ms) + Œ¥œÑ)
                                  ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f m‚á©0) b))  ‚Ä∫
    using first_time_image[OF *] dilating_def * by fastforce
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet ((Rep_run r) n a)
                  ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm ‚â• n. first_time r ms m (time ((Rep_run r) n ms) + Œ¥œÑ)
                                ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) m b))‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { fix n assume assm:‚Äπhamlet ((Rep_run r) n a)‚Ä∫
      from ticks_image_sub[OF * assm] obtain n‚á©0 where nfn0:‚Äπn = f n‚á©0‚Ä∫ by blast
      with ** assm have ft0:
        ‚Äπ(‚àÄm‚á©0 ‚â• n‚á©0. first_time r ms (f m‚á©0) (time ((Rep_run r) (f n‚á©0) ms) + Œ¥œÑ)
                    ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) (f m‚á©0) b))‚Ä∫ by blast
      have ‚Äπ(‚àÄm ‚â• n. first_time r ms m (time ((Rep_run r) n ms) + Œ¥œÑ) 
                       ‚ü∂ hamlet ((Rep_run r) m b)) ‚Ä∫
      proof -
      { fix m assume hyp:‚Äπm ‚â• n‚Ä∫
        have ‚Äπfirst_time r ms m (time (Rep_run r n ms) + Œ¥œÑ) ‚ü∂ hamlet (Rep_run r m b)‚Ä∫
        proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉm‚á©0. f m‚á©0 = m‚Ä∫)
          case True
          from this obtain m‚á©0 where ‚Äπm = f m‚á©0‚Ä∫ by blast
          moreover have ‚Äπstrict_mono f‚Ä∫ using * by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
          ultimately show ?thesis using ft0 hyp nfn0 by (simp add: strict_mono_less_eq)
        next
          case False thus ?thesis
          proof (cases ‚Äπm = 0‚Ä∫)
            case True
              hence ‚Äπm = f 0‚Ä∫ using * by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
              then show ?thesis using False by blast
          next
            case False
            hence ‚Äπ‚àÉpm. m = Suc pm‚Ä∫ by (simp add: not0_implies_Suc)
            from this obtain pm where mpm:‚Äπm = Suc pm‚Ä∫ by blast
            hence ‚Äπ‚àÑpm‚á©0. f pm‚á©0 = Suc pm‚Ä∫ using ‚Äπ‚àÑm‚á©0. f m‚á©0 = m‚Ä∫ by simp 
            with *  have ‚Äπtime (Rep_run r (Suc pm) ms) = time (Rep_run r pm ms)‚Ä∫
              using dilating_def dilating_fun_def by blast
            hence ‚Äπtime (Rep_run r pm ms) = time (Rep_run r m ms)‚Ä∫ using mpm by simp
            moreover from mpm have ‚Äπpm < m‚Ä∫ by simp
            ultimately have ‚Äπ‚àÉm' < m. time (Rep_run r m' ms) = time (Rep_run r m ms)‚Ä∫ by blast
            hence ‚Äπ¬¨(first_time r ms m (time (Rep_run r n ms) + Œ¥œÑ))‚Ä∫
              by (auto simp add: first_time_def)
            thus ?thesis by simp
          qed
        qed
      } thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    } thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚ÄπTime relations are preserved through dilation of a run.‚Ä∫
lemma tagrel_sub':
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ time-relation ‚åäc‚á©1,c‚á©2‚åã ‚àà R ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚ÄπR (time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2))‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from assms(2) TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(2) have
    ‚Äπsub ‚àà {r. ‚àÄn. R (time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2))}‚Ä∫ by blast
  hence 1:‚Äπ‚àÄn. R (time ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run sub) n c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
  show ?thesis
  proof (induction n)
    case 0
      from 1 have ‚ÄπR (time ((Rep_run sub) 0 c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run sub) 0 c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
      moreover from * have ‚Äπf 0 = 0‚Ä∫ by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def)
      moreover from * have ‚Äπ‚àÄc. time ((Rep_run sub) 0 c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f 0) c)‚Ä∫
        by (simp add: dilating_def)
      ultimately show ?case by simp
  next
    case (Suc n)
    then show ?case
    proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÑn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫)
      case True
      with * have ‚Äπ‚àÄc. time (Rep_run r (Suc n) c) = time (Rep_run r n c)‚Ä∫
        by (simp add: dilating_def dilating_fun_def) 
      thus ?thesis using Suc.IH by simp
    next
      case False
      from this obtain n‚á©0 where n‚á©0prop:‚Äπf n‚á©0 = Suc n‚Ä∫ by blast
      from 1 have ‚ÄπR (time ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
      moreover from n‚á©0prop * have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©1) = time ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c‚á©1)‚Ä∫
        by (simp add: dilating_def)
      moreover from n‚á©0prop * have ‚Äπtime ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©2) = time ((Rep_run r) (Suc n) c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
        by (simp add: dilating_def)
      ultimately show ?thesis by simp
    qed
  qed
qed

corollary tagrel_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ time-relation ‚åäc‚á©1,c‚á©2‚åã ‚àà R ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ time-relation ‚åäc‚á©1,c‚á©2‚åã ‚àà R ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
using tagrel_sub'[OF assms] unfolding TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(3) by simp

text ‚ÄπTime relations are also preserved by contraction‚Ä∫
lemma tagrel_sub_inv:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ time-relation ‚åäc‚á©1, c‚á©2‚åã ‚àà R ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ time-relation ‚åäc‚á©1, c‚á©2‚åã ‚àà R ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where df:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from assms(2) TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(2) have
    ‚Äπr ‚àà {œÅ. ‚àÄn. R (time ((Rep_run œÅ) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run œÅ) n c‚á©2))}‚Ä∫ by blast
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. R (time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. (‚àÉn‚á©0. f n‚á©0 = n) ‚ü∂ R (time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run r) n c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn‚á©0. R (time ((Rep_run r) (f n‚á©0) c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run r) (f n‚á©0) c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by blast
  moreover from dilating_def df have
    ‚Äπ‚àÄn c. time ((Rep_run sub) n c) = time ((Rep_run r) (f n) c)‚Ä∫ by blast
  ultimately have ‚Äπ‚àÄn‚á©0. R (time ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©1), time ((Rep_run sub) n‚á©0 c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by auto
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Kill relations are preserved in a dilated run.
‚Ä∫
theorem kill_sub:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ c‚á©1 kills c‚á©2 ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ c‚á©1 kills c‚á©2 ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof -
  from assms(1) is_subrun_def obtain f where *:‚Äπdilating f sub r‚Ä∫ by blast
  from assms(2) TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(8) have
    ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet (Rep_run sub n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm‚â•n. ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run sub m c‚á©2))‚Ä∫ by simp
  hence 1:‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet (Rep_run r (f n) c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm‚â•n. ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r (f m) c‚á©2))‚Ä∫
    using ticks_sub[OF *] by simp
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet (Rep_run r (f n) c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm‚â• (f n). ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r m c‚á©2))‚Ä∫
  proof -
    { fix n assume ‚Äπhamlet (Rep_run r (f n) c‚á©1)‚Ä∫
      with 1 have 2:‚Äπ‚àÄ m ‚â• n. ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r (f m) c‚á©2)‚Ä∫ by simp
      have ‚Äπ‚àÄ m‚â• (f n). ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r m c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
      proof -
        { fix m assume h:‚Äπm ‚â• f n‚Ä∫
          have ‚Äπ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r m c‚á©2)‚Ä∫
          proof (cases ‚Äπ‚àÉm‚á©0. f m‚á©0 = m‚Ä∫)
            case True
              from this obtain m‚á©0 where fm0:‚Äπf m‚á©0 = m‚Ä∫ by blast
              hence ‚Äπm‚á©0 ‚â• n‚Ä∫
                using * dilating_def dilating_fun_def h strict_mono_less_eq by fastforce
              with 2 show ?thesis using fm0 by blast
          next
            case False
              thus ?thesis  using ticks_image_sub'[OF *] by blast
          qed
        } thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    } thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
  hence ‚Äπ‚àÄn. hamlet (Rep_run r n c‚á©1) ‚ü∂ (‚àÄm ‚â• n. ¬¨ hamlet (Rep_run r m c‚á©2))‚Ä∫
    using ticks_imp_ticks_subk[OF *] by blast
  thus ?thesis using TESL_interpretation_atomic.simps(8) by blast
qed

lemmas atomic_sub_lemmas = sporadic_sub tagrel_sub implies_sub implies_not_sub
                           time_delayed_sub weakly_precedes_sub
                           strictly_precedes_sub kill_sub

text ‚Äπ
  We can now prove that all atomic specification formulae are preserved
  by the dilation of runs.
‚Ä∫
lemma atomic_sub: 
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
      and ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ œÜ ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ œÜ ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
using assms(2) atomic_sub_lemmas[OF assms(1)] by (cases œÜ, simp_all)

text ‚Äπ
  Finally, any TESL specification is invariant by stuttering.
‚Ä∫
theorem TESL_stuttering_invariant:
  assumes ‚Äπsub ‚â™ r‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶‚ü¶ S ‚üß‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L ‚üπ r ‚àà ‚ü¶‚ü¶ S ‚üß‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
proof (induction S)
  case Nil
    thus ?case by simp
next
  case (Cons a s)
    from Cons.prems have sa:‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶ a ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫ and sb:‚Äπsub ‚àà ‚ü¶‚ü¶ s ‚üß‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫
      using TESL_interpretation_image by simp+
    from Cons.IH[OF sb] have ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶‚ü¶ s ‚üß‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫ .
    moreover from atomic_sub[OF assms(1) sa] have ‚Äπr ‚àà ‚ü¶ a ‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L‚Ä∫ .
    ultimately show ?case using  TESL_interpretation_image by simp
qed

end

Theory Config_Morphisms

theory Config_Morphisms
  imports Hygge_Theory
begin

text ‚Äπ
  TESL morphisms change the time on clocks, preserving the ticks.
‚Ä∫
consts morphism :: ‚Äπ'a ‚áí ('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ::linorder) ‚áí 'a‚Ä∫ (infixl ‚Äπ‚®Ç‚Ä∫ 100)

text ‚Äπ
  Applying a TESL morphism to a tag simply changes its value.
‚Ä∫
overloading morphism_tagconst ‚â° ‚Äπmorphism :: 'œÑ tag_const ‚áí ('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ) ‚áí 'œÑ tag_const‚Ä∫ 
begin 
  definition morphism_tagconst :  
          ‚Äπ(x::'œÑ tag_const) ‚®Ç (f::('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ)) = (œÑ‚á©c‚á©s‚á©t o f)(the_tag_const x) ‚Ä∫ 
end

text ‚Äπ
  Applying a TESL morphism to an atomic formula only changes the dates.
‚Ä∫
overloading morphism_TESL_atomic ‚â° 
            ‚Äπmorphism :: 'œÑ TESL_atomic ‚áí ('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ) ‚áí 'œÑ TESL_atomic‚Ä∫ 
begin 
definition morphism_TESL_atomic : 
          ‚Äπ(Œ®::'œÑ TESL_atomic) ‚®Ç (f::('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ)) = 
              (case Œ® of
                (C sporadic t on C')     ‚áí (C sporadic (t‚®Çf) on C') 
              | (time-relation ‚åäC, C'‚åã‚ààR)‚áí (time-relation ‚åäC, C'‚åã ‚àà (Œª(t, t'). R(t‚®Çf,t'‚®Çf)))
              | (C implies C')           ‚áí (C implies C')
              | (C implies not C')       ‚áí (C implies not C')       
              | (C time-delayed by t on C' implies C'') 
                                         ‚áí (C time-delayed by t‚®Çf on C' implies C'')
              | (C weakly precedes C')   ‚áí (C weakly precedes C')
              | (C strictly precedes C') ‚áí (C strictly precedes C') 
              | (C kills C')             ‚áí (C kills C'))‚Ä∫ 
end

text ‚Äπ
  Applying a TESL morphism to a formula amounts to apply it to each atomic formula.
‚Ä∫
overloading morphism_TESL_formula ‚â° 
            ‚Äπmorphism :: 'œÑ TESL_formula ‚áí ('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ) ‚áí 'œÑ TESL_formula‚Ä∫ 
begin 
definition  morphism_TESL_formula : 
           ‚Äπ(Œ®::'œÑ TESL_formula) ‚®Ç (f::('œÑ::linorder ‚áí 'œÑ)) = map (Œªx. x ‚®Ç f) Œ®‚Ä∫ 
end


text ‚Äπ
  Applying a TESL morphism to a configuration amounts to apply it to the 
  present and future formulae. The past (in the context @{term ‚ÄπŒì‚Ä∫}) is not changed.
‚Ä∫
overloading morphism_TESL_config ‚â° 
            ‚Äπmorphism :: ('œÑ::linordered_field) config ‚áí ('œÑ ‚áí 'œÑ) ‚áí 'œÑ config‚Ä∫ 
begin 
fun  morphism_TESL_config 
  where  ‚Äπ((Œì, n ‚ä¢ Œ® ‚ñπ Œ¶)::('œÑ::linordered_field) config) ‚®Ç (f::('œÑ ‚áí 'œÑ)) =
           (Œì, n ‚ä¢ (Œ®‚®Çf) ‚ñπ (Œ¶‚®Çf))‚Ä∫ 
end

text ‚Äπ
  A TESL formula is called consistent if it possesses Kripke-models 
  in its denotational interpretation.
‚Ä∫

definition consistent :: ‚Äπ('œÑ::linordered_field) TESL_formula ‚áí bool‚Ä∫ 
  where   ‚Äπconsistent Œ® ‚â° ‚ü¶‚ü¶ Œ® ‚üß‚üß‚á©T‚á©E‚á©S‚á©L ‚â† {}‚Ä∫


text ‚Äπ
  If we can derive a consistent finite context from a TESL formula, the formula is consistent. 
‚Ä∫
theorem consistency_finite :
  assumes start             : ‚Äπ([], 0 ‚ä¢ Œ® ‚ñπ [])  ‚Ü™‚áß*‚áß* (Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ [] ‚ñπ [])‚Ä∫
      and init_invariant    : ‚Äπconsistent_context Œì‚á©1‚Ä∫
    shows ‚Äπconsistent Œ®‚Ä∫    
proof -
  have * : ‚Äπ‚àÉ n. (([], 0 ‚ä¢ Œ® ‚ñπ []) ‚Ü™‚áón‚áñ (Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ [] ‚ñπ []))‚Ä∫
    by (simp add: rtranclp_imp_relpowp start)
  show ?thesis
  unfolding consistent_context_def consistent_def
  using * consistent_context_def init_invariant soundness by fastforce
qed

subsubsection ‚ÄπSnippets on runs‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  A run with no ticks and constant time for all clocks.
‚Ä∫
definition const_nontick_run :: ‚Äπ(clock ‚áí 'œÑ tag_const) ‚áí ('œÑ::linordered_field) run ‚Ä∫ (‚Äπ‚ñ°_‚Ä∫ 80)
  where ‚Äπ‚ñ°f ‚â°  Abs_run(Œªn c. (False, f c))‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Ensure a clock ticks in a run at a given instant.
‚Ä∫
definition set_tick :: ‚Äπ('œÑ::linordered_field) run ‚áí nat ‚áí clock ‚áí ('œÑ) run‚Ä∫ 
  where   ‚Äπset_tick r k c = Abs_run(Œªn c.  if k = n 
                                           then (True , time(Rep_run r k c)) 
                                           else Rep_run r k c) ‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Ensure a clock does not tick in a run at a given instant.
‚Ä∫
definition unset_tick :: ‚Äπ('œÑ::linordered_field) run ‚áí nat ‚áí clock ‚áí ('œÑ) run‚Ä∫ 
  where   ‚Äπunset_tick r k c = Abs_run(Œªn c.  if k = n 
                                           then (False , time(Rep_run r k c)) 
                                           else Rep_run r k c) ‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Replace all instants after k in a run with the instants from another run.
  Warning: the result may not be a proper run since time may not be monotonous
  from instant k to instant k+1.
‚Ä∫
definition patch :: ‚Äπ('œÑ::linordered_field) run ‚áí nat ‚áí 'œÑ run ‚áí 'œÑ run‚Ä∫ (‚Äπ_ ‚â´‚áó_‚áñ _‚Ä∫ 80)
  where   ‚Äπr ‚â´‚áók‚áñr' ‚â° Abs_run(Œªn c. if n ‚â§ k then Rep_run (r) n c else  Rep_run (r') n c)‚Ä∫



text ‚Äπ
  For some infinite cases, the idea for a proof scheme looks as follows: if we can derive
  from the initial configuration @{term ‚Äπ([], 0 ‚ä¢ Œ® ‚ñπ [])‚Ä∫} a start-point of a lasso
  @{term ‚Äπ(Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©1 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©1)‚Ä∫}, and if we can traverse the lasso one time 
  @{term ‚Äπ(Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©1 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©1) ‚Ü™‚áß+‚áß+ (Œì‚á©2, n‚á©2 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©2 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©2)‚Ä∫} to isomorphic one, 
  we can always always make a derivation along the lasso. If the entry point of the lasso had traces 
  with prefixes consistent to @{term ‚ÄπŒì‚á©1‚Ä∫}, then there exist traces consisting of this prefix and 
  repetitions of the delta-prefix of the lasso which are consistent with @{term ‚ÄπŒ®‚Ä∫} which implies
  the logical consistency of  @{term ‚ÄπŒ®‚Ä∫}.
  
  So far the idea. Remains to prove it. Why does one symbolic run along a lasso generalises to 
  arbitrary runs ? 
‚Ä∫

theorem consistency_coinduct : 
  assumes start             : ‚Äπ([], 0 ‚ä¢ Œ® ‚ñπ [])   ‚Ü™‚áß*‚áß* (Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©1 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©1)‚Ä∫
      and loop              : ‚Äπ(Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©1 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©1) ‚Ü™‚áß+‚áß+ (Œì‚á©2, n‚á©2 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©2 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©2)‚Ä∫
      and init_invariant    : ‚Äπconsistent_context Œì‚á©1‚Ä∫
      and post_invariant    : ‚Äπconsistent_context Œì‚á©2‚Ä∫
      and retract_condition : ‚Äπ(Œì‚á©2, n‚á©2 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©2 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©2) ‚®Ç (f::'œÑ ‚áí 'œÑ) = (Œì‚á©1, n‚á©1 ‚ä¢ Œ®‚á©1 ‚ñπ Œ¶‚á©1) ‚Ä∫ 
    shows ‚Äπconsistent (Œ® :: ('œÑ :: linordered_field)TESL_formula)‚Ä∫    
oops

end
